leave blank4*p44839a0424*2. a spacecraft s of mass m moves in a straight line towards the centre of the earth.  the earth is modelled as a sphere of radius r and s is modelled as a particle.  when s is at  a distance x, x . r, from the centre of the earth, the force exerted by the earth on s is directed  towards the centre of the earth.  the force has magnitude kx2 , where k is a constant. (a) show that k = mgr2(2) when s is at a distance 3r from the centre of the earth, the speed of s is v.  assuming that air resistance can be ignored, (b) find, in terms of g, r and v, the speed of s as it hits the surface of the earth.(7)

leave blank8*p44839a0824*3. at time t = 0, a particle p is at the origin o, moving with speed 8 m s–1 in the  positive x direction.  at time t seconds, t . 0, the acceleration of p has magnitude 2(t + 4)– 12 ms–2 and is directed towards o. (a) show that, at time t seconds, the velocity of p is 16 – 4(t + 4)12 ms–1(5) (b) find the distance of p from o when p comes to instantaneous rest.(7)

leave blank12*p44839a01224*4.figure 2 a particle of mass 3m is attached to one end of a light inextensible string of length a.  the other end of the string is attached to a fixed point o.  the particle is held at the point a, where oa is horizontal and oa = a.  the particle is projected vertically downwards from a with speed u, as shown in figure 2.  the particle moves in complete vertical circles. (a) show that u2 .3ag.(7) given that the greatest tension in the string is three times the least tension in the string, (b) show that u2 =6ag.(5)aoau

leave blank16*p44839a01624*5.figure 3 two fixed points a and b are 5 m apart on a smooth horizontal floor.  a particle p of mass 0.5 kg is attached to one end of a light elastic string, of natural length 2 m and modulus of elasticity 20 n.  the other end of the string is attached to a.  a second light elastic string, of natural length 1.2 m and modulus of elasticity 15 n, has one end attached to p and the other end attached to b. initially p rests in equilibrium at the point o, as shown in figure 3. (a) show that ao = 3 m.(4) the particle is now pulled towards a and released from rest at the point c, where acb is a straight line and oc = 1 m. (b) show that, while both strings are taut, p moves with simple harmonic motion.(4) (c) find the speed of p at the instant when the string pb becomes slack.(4) the particle first comes to instantaneous rest at the point d. (d) find the distance db.(5)5 moabp(0.5 kg)

(c) find the distance from v to the centre of mass of t.(5) the point a lies on the circumference of the base of the cone.  the solid t is suspended from a and hangs freely in equilibrium.
